column4: Hey there! Got some trouble with booting from MARVELL raid after updating the BIOS; Ubuntu doesn't find the raid drive, which I used to boot from. Windows 7 does, so I think the raid itself is still ok. fdisk on live-system won't show the disk either. Could someone help me out please?
you'll find that common with all fakeraid devices
using fakeraid is something I'd try to avoid at all costs
but it worked until this update; any idea how to fix this?
I suspect the support/inbuilt driver will have changed between kernels and that device is no longer usable
again - fake raid is the devil
so i have to downgrade my bios again and hope, that I will show up agian?
I just wouldn't use it at all, and swap to software raid
can I use the software-raid from linux and windows? doesn't it slow down the system?
software raid is not cross-platform, so your windows disk won't see it
in terms of performance there is no difference between software raid and fake raid, they both use the machines cpu (that's why it's called fake raid)
so best would be to use a raid-controller?!
a hardware raid controller is good, software raid if you only need Linux support, fakeraid (for me) never
got an idea, how much a raid-controller should be?
$400 is the average, look up LSI and 3ware
ok, thank you for your help! I'll try to recover my data using the old bios and then delete the fakeraid.
not the help you where looking for I know, but it will serve you well in the long run
well, i the end i learned a bit, so it was worth it ;)
